data.name: Gloom
data.flavorText: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Foul Odor
attacks.text: Both this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon are now Confused.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Stinky Scent
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.

data.name: Gloom

abilities.name: Irresistible Aroma
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if your opponent's Bench isn't full, you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent reveals their hand. Put a Basic Pokémon you find there onto their Bench.

data.flavorText: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Miracle Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Special Condition. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

data.flavorText: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

data.name: Dark Gloom

abilities.name: Pollen Stench
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused; if tails, your Active Pokémon is now Confused. This power can't be used if Dark Gloom is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Its pollen has such a strong smell that it even confuses itself at times.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Strange Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Sticky Nectar
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage and, until the end of your next turn, as long as Gloom is your Active Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat, and if the effect of an attack, Pokémon Power, or Trainer card would change that player's Active Pokémon, that part of the effect does nothing. If tails, this attack does 20 damage.

data.flavorText: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

attacks.name: Cling
attacks.text: After your attack, remove from Gloom the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon. If Gloom has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Double Razor Leaf
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Foul Odor
attacks.text: Both the Defending Pokémon and Gloom are now Confused (after doing damage).

data.flavorText: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool; it is a nectar that is used to attract prey.

attacks.name: Healing Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 4 damage counters from Erika's Gloom. If Erika's Gloom has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Magic Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned (your choice).

attacks.name: Dream Dance
attacks.text: Both the Defending Pokémon and Erika's Gloom are now Asleep (after doing damage).

attacks.name: Vile Smell
attacks.text: Both the Defending Pokémon and Erika's Gloom are now Confused (after doing damage).

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

abilities.name: Enervating Pollen
abilities.text: As long as Gloom is in play, Resistance on each player's Active Pokémon only reduces damage by 10.

attacks.name: Sleep Sap
attacks.text: Both the Defending Pokémon and Gloom are now Asleep (after doing damage).

attacks.name: Foul Odor
attacks.text: Both the Defending Pokémon and Gloom are now Confused (after doing damage).

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Frustration
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that doesn't have any damage counters on it. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Space Out
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Gloom. Gloom is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Stinky Nectar
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Offensive Scent
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Inviting Scent
attacks.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

data.flavorText: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Inviting Scent
attacks.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

data.flavorText: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

data.name: Gloom

abilities.name: Semi-Blooming Energy
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and attach any number of Basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.flavorText: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

data.name: Gloom

abilities.name: Semi-Blooming Energy
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and attach any number of Basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.flavorText: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Disperse Drool
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.
